description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger, from two first texts. Physical description: 15 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh in black ink with use of red for some words and text-stops. Thick dark cream paper, glossy, with chain and laid lines visible. The text is vocalized. Titles written in red with vocalization in black, except titles on fol. 54a and 57a, in gold (outlined in black), with red for vocalization and filling. Table of contents on the pastedown of the lower cover. Leaves missing between fol. 6 and 7, 53 and 54. Worm-eaten. Inscription on a label pasted on the upper cover: "395" (in Arabic numerals, and in Western numerals). Repeated on the margin of fol. 1a, in the form: "numrah 395".
abstract: Acephalous and defective collection of twenty-eight texts of the Druze community, comprising texts 71-74, 77-78, 82-85, 89-90, 97-108, 119-122 in Sylvestre de Sacy's description in Exposé de la religion des Druzes (1838), followed by a short text by another hand on fol. 83b-84b.
contents: 29. fol. 83b-84b: [Short text by a later hand, incomplete, starting with: "Qawluhu inna [---] al-ḥakīm al-muqām al-mawjūd"]
extent: 84 leaves: paper ; 205 x 150 (140 x 110) mm. bound to 215 x 170 mm.
title: Miʻrāj najāt al-muwaḥḥidīn wa-sullam ḥayāt al-mūqinīn. al-Risālah fī dhikr al-maʻād wa-al-radd ʻalá man ʻabbara ʻanhu bi-al-ghalaṭ wa-al-ilḥād ... [etc.].
uniform title: Miʻrāj najāt al-muwaḥḥidīn wa-sullam ḥayāt al-mūqinīn. al-Risālah fī dhikr al-maʻād wa-al-radd ʻalá man ʻabbara ʻanhu bi-al-ghalaṭ wa-al-ilḥād ... [etc.].
provenance: Acquired by Robert Garrett from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut), 1925.
subject: Druzes—Sacred books
binding note: Paper over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers. Spine wanting. Paper pastedowns.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
